hook.text: The most common curable STI in the world is caused not by a bacterium but by a tiny parasite.

buildup.text: Trichomonas vaginalis is a single-celled protozoan that infects the urogenital tract.

discovery.text: Symptoms include irritation and discharge, but about 70% of infected people show no signs at all.

twist.text: Trichomoniasis increases vulnerability to other STIs, including HIV, by damaging mucosal barriers.

climax.text: A single dose of the antibiotic metronidazole cures trichomoniasis quickly and effectively.

punchline.text: A tiny parasite with outsized consequences.

quiz.question: What type of organism causes trichomoniasis?
